content.description: Sit start the right arete using a crimp and a right pocket. Climb up through a jug, a pinch, a gaston crack, and more jugs to the lip of the boulder and topout. Stand start goes at around V1.
content.location: This line goes up the right arete of the stacked rectangular boulder. This line will be on the left boulder as you are walking into the area on the downhill side. Yellow line on the topo.

content.description: Sit start in the hold on a sloping shelf and use footholds underneath. Traverse left towards the arete to a jug. Figure out the body positioning to use a fragile pinch on the left side of the arete to throw to the lip and topout. Multiple variations have been done, but this is best one.
content.protection: Three pads since the landing is rather rocky, it is called hip check for a reason.
content.location: This line starts around the corner of the unsuspecting small boulder all the way to the right of the Block Party Area. Yellow on the topo.

content.description: Sit start on small holds below the horizontal crack. Climb up to a jug and move up and slightly left to a sloping but juggy topout.
content.location: This line goes up the middle of the right side of the main boulder of the Block Party Area. Yellow line on the topo.

content.description: Sit start on good crimps. Climb up and slightly right to slopers or pinches. Find more crimps up and left and topout to the right of the very large detached (but solid) block.
content.location: This line goes straight up the center of the main boulder at the Block Party Area.
